text: Harold King (1904-1978) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. Harry King came to St. George from Main Arm, near Mullumbimby, New South Wales in 1922 during the club's second season in the NSWRFL. King played his junior football with Mullumbimby Rugby Union Club with his best mate Vic Armbruster. Harry King stayed two seasons at Saints before joining Eastern Suburbs in 1925 for a season before heading back to Queensland to get married in 1926. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. Rugby League Project https://www.rugbyleagueproject.org/players/harold-king/summary.html Harry King died in August 1978 in Buderim, Queensland Ancestry.com.au https://www.ancestry.com.au/family- tree/person/tree/74597224/person/38293910008/facts ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:1904 births Category:1978 deaths Category:Sydney Roosters players
